title: Cognitive Testing
description: Computer-based tasks to assess thinking and memory

procedures.title: Welcome & Setup
procedures.description: We'll greet you and get you settled in a comfortable chair at a computer
details: You'll sit in a quiet, well-lit room
The computer screen will be at eye level
We'll adjust the chair height for comfort

procedures.title: Instructions
procedures.description: We'll explain each task before you start, and you can practice first
details: Clear, simple instructions for each activity
Practice rounds so you feel confident
No time pressure during explanations

procedures.title: Memory Tasks
procedures.description: You'll see words, numbers, or pictures and try to remember them
details: Items appear on screen one at a time
Some tasks ask you to remember order
Others ask you to recognize what you've seen before

procedures.title: Attention Tasks
procedures.description: Simple activities that test your focus and concentration
details: You might press keys when you see certain shapes
Or follow moving objects on screen
Tasks are like simple computer games

procedures.title: Wrap Up
procedures.description: We'll thank you and answer any questions you have
details: Brief discussion about how it went
Information about next steps (if any)
Contact information for follow-up questions

title: Brain Imaging (MRI)
description: Safe, non-invasive brain scan to see brain structure and activity

procedures.title: Preparation
procedures.description: You'll change into comfortable clothes without metal
details: Hospital gown or metal-free clothing provided
Remove jewelry, watches, and metal objects
Secure storage provided for your belongings

procedures.title: Safety Check
procedures.description: We'll review safety questions and explain the MRI process
details: Questions about medical implants or metal in body
Explanation of loud noises you'll hear
Emergency button you can press anytime

procedures.title: Getting Positioned
procedures.description: You'll lie on a comfortable table that slides into the MRI machine
details: Padded table with pillow and blanket
Head coil positioned around your head
Earplugs and headphones for noise protection

procedures.title: The Scan
procedures.description: You'll need to stay still while the machine takes pictures of your brain
details: Loud knocking and buzzing sounds are normal
Each scan sequence lasts 2-10 minutes
We can talk to you between sequences

procedures.title: Finishing Up
procedures.description: The table slides out and you can get up and get dressed
details: No side effects from the scan
You can resume normal activities immediately
Results will be shared with your doctor

title: Blood Sample Collection
description: Quick and simple blood draw for research analysis

procedures.title: Check-in
procedures.description: We'll verify your information and have you sit in a comfortable chair
details: Confirm your identity and study participation
Review any medications you're taking
Comfortable chair with arm support

procedures.title: Preparation
procedures.description: The phlebotomist will clean the area and prepare the equipment
details: Alcohol wipe to clean your arm
Sterile needle and collection tubes
Tourniquet to make veins more visible

procedures.title: Blood Draw
procedures.description: Quick needle stick to collect the blood sample
details: Brief pinch when needle goes in
You might feel slight pressure
Usually takes less than 2 minutes

procedures.title: Aftercare
procedures.description: We'll apply pressure and a bandage to the site
details: Direct pressure to prevent bleeding
Small bandage or cotton ball with tape
Instructions for care over next few hours

title: Survey & Interview
description: Conversation about your health, lifestyle, and experiences

procedures.title: Welcome
procedures.description: We'll introduce ourselves and explain the interview process
details: Comfortable, private room for talking
Explanation of confidentiality
Permission to record (if applicable)

procedures.title: Background Questions
procedures.description: Questions about your basic information and health history
details: Age, education, and occupation
General health and medical history
Family health background

procedures.title: Specific Topics
procedures.description: Detailed questions related to the research study
details: Questions specific to the study focus
Your experiences and opinions
No right or wrong answers

procedures.title: Wrap Up
procedures.description: Final questions and opportunity for you to ask anything
details: Review of key points discussed
Your questions about the study
Information about next steps
